heaviest_rainfall.status: 36.8mm of rain was recorded as having fallen on 04 January 2025, marking an exceptional 37.2 hour precipitation event.  At times the rain was falling at 4.6mm per hour.

heaviest_rainrate.status: Today, the rain fell at an intense rate peaking at 16.6mm per hour, one of the heaviest downpours recorded and ranked 2nd from our records.  The precipitation lasted 3.2 hours and dumped 5.69mm in total.  The heaviest rain rate registered stands at 27.0mm per hour on 02 September 2025, highlighting an extreme precipitation event.  21.19mm fell during the storm over 15.0 hours.

longest_rain.status: The record duration for continuous rain was set on 04 January 2025, the storm lasted 37.2 hours with a total precipitation of 36.8mm and it reached 4.6mm per hour at times.

storm.status: There is a storm around.  It's the first significant stormy weather event since 03 September 2025.

top_10_dry.status: The longest dry period started on 24 April 2025 and lasted for 19 days.

top_10_rainy.status: A significant rainy period is on-going and is ranked 4th for length since August 2024.  So far, it has lasted 10 consecutive days beginning 26 August 2025.  The longest rainy period started on 30 November 2024 and lasted for 10 days.

cold_snaps.status: There is not an active cold snap.  There has been 6 so far this year, while the average is 3.7.

extreme.status: The maximum temperature difference seen is 26.7°C, observed on 29 April 2025 when the temperature fell to 0.4°C but also managed to reach 27.1°C on the same day.

heatwave.status: There is not an active heatwave.  There has been 6 so far this year, while the average is 1.9.

tropical: The last tropical night was 18 July 2025, there have been only 62 tropical nights since 1973.

average.status: The current wind direction is southerly (197°), which is about average.  In the UK, a southerly wind usually brings milder, moist air from the Atlantic.

gusts.status: 93.7 mph was the largest wind gust recorded on 13 October 2012.

run.status: The top recorded wind run is 1754 miles on 21 October 2012.

speed.status: The largest wind speed ever was on 13 October 2012 with a value of 93.7 mph.

top_10_windy.status: The longest windy period started on 11 October 2012 and lasted for 21 days.

summary.description:
Today, cooler for the feels like temperature (down 2.0°C) and drier conditions in outside humidity (down 9%) and rainfall (down 1.3 mm).

Compared to today, yesterday also had noticeable differences in rainfall (up 1.3 mm).

The past week and month had observable variation in feels like temperature (up 1.9°C), inside temperature (up 1.8°C), and cloud levels (up 723 m) when compared to today.

cloud levels.description:
Today’s average cloud levels is 777.7m higher than yesterday, 338.9m higher than the past week, 722.6m lower than the past month.

The cloud levels yesterday fell between 565m minimum and 1838m maximum, with an average of 1888.2m; weekly and monthly averages were marginally higher at 1549.2m and 2610m.
cloud levels.summary: Clouds will be high, allowing good sunlight.

summary.summary: Inside; a mild and comfortable temperature is anticipated. Outside; temperatures should feel nicely warm. Also, air will feel comfortable and balanced and little or no wind. Some rain can be expected, clouds will be high, allowing good sunlight, and strong and powerful sunlight. Low pressure may lead to stormy or rainy weather.
